qa_multi_document_information_integratio.question: According to the hospitalization records of Oxford General Hospital and Windsor General Hospital, what were the chief complaints of patients G. Gonzalez and K. Ramos?

content: Severe left-sided back pain and hematuria for 2 days
Severe bone pain and difficulty in walking for 3 days.

qa_multi_document_information_integratio.answer: According to the hospitalization records of Oxford General Hospital, patient G. Gonzalez's chief complaint was severe left-sided back pain and hematuria for 2 days. According to the hospitalization records of Windsor General Hospital, patient K. Ramos's chief complaint was severe bone pain and difficulty in walking for 3 days.

qa_multi_document_information_integratio.question: According to the hospitalization records of Oxford General Hospital and Windsor General Hospital, what were the preliminary diagnoses for patients G. Gonzalez and K. Ramos?
qa_multi_document_information_integratio.answer: According to the hospitalization records of Oxford General Hospital, patient G. Gonzalez was preliminarily diagnosed with urinary tract stones (left renal calculi) and hematuria. According to the hospitalization records of Windsor General Hospital, patient K. Ramos was preliminarily diagnosed with acute osteomyelitis.

qa_multi_document_compare.question: According to the hospitalization records of Oxford General Hospital and Windsor General Hospital, who was admitted earlier, G. Gonzalez or K. Ramos?
qa_multi_document_compare.answer: G. Gonzalez was admitted on 24th July, and K. Ramos was admitted on 26th October. G. Gonzalez was admitted earlier.

qa_multi_document_compare.question: According to the hospitalization records of Oxford General Hospital and Windsor General Hospital, whose pulse rate is higher, G. Gonzalez or K. Ramos?
qa_multi_document_compare.answer: G. Gonzalez's pulse rate is 90 bpm, and K. Ramos's pulse rate is 88 bpm. G. Gonzalez's pulse rate is higher.

qa_multi_document_compare.question: According to the hospitalization records of Oxford General Hospital and Windsor General Hospital, who had a higher temperature, G. Gonzalez or K. Ramos?
